column4: Support for HFS+ is not implemented yet "No space left on disk"
Just...
How could I make the windows partition? Seriously. This makes no sense.
I can't partition with gparted.
It tells me that support for HFS+ is not implemented yet
I try to partition as FAT32, it goes insane a few seconds in and says something about administratyive rights.
YES.
GOD. Is it IMPOSSIBLE to do it?
And Windows with it, too.
Yes. I'm trying to resize it
what are you trying to do exactly?
why don't you use diskutil or whatever the app is on osx
can you please address the person you are speaking to?
Forgive me. But yes, it's...weird.
Even hardcore mac users (Ha!) have no idea how the thing works.
it is assuming you can create free space for it :)
did you try using the bootcamp setup to do the resizing?
...That's...a good point.

I have a macbook 4,1, as long as hfs+ is what os x gets installed on by default, then definitely yes you can resize it using gparted.   Note, I used sysrescuecd, not ubuntu, so I don't know if our gparted versions differ
how are either harmful?
Mac users are basically yelling in my face, telling me that insalling Ubunbu on my MacBookPro will cause electronic tunnel damage to my CPU.
well ask them for some proof I guess, but I've been using it for over a year on my macbook
also, have you checked if help.ubuntu.com/community/MacBook addresses your issue at all?
if in the end we can't figure it out, try sysrescuecd (that's the one I used and know for sure has support)
